definition: to screen/to discriminate/to reexamine a case/screening (of applicants etc)
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to screen/to grade by examination/screening/placement test

sentences.english: The "Crows Nest" has screened venting to provide additional ventilation.
sentences.chinese: 在“乌鸦巢”的甄别，以提供额外的排气通风。

sentences.english: Dr. Biederman says the theory behind identifying travel personalities is solid.
sentences.chinese: 彼得曼博士说，“旅游个性”的甄别理论是可靠的。

sentences.english: This has been the most closely watched and carefully scrutinized pandemic in history.
sentences.chinese: 这是有史以来受到最严密监测和认真甄别的大流行病。

sentences.english: The advanced screening tools include gene chips and tissue culture methods.
sentences.chinese: 先进的甄别工具包括基因芯片和组织培养法。
同位素甄别是不可能的。

sentences.english: In Scotland men and women aged between 50 and 74 are screened .
sentences.chinese: 在苏格兰男性和女性，年龄介乎50和74进行甄别。

sentences.english: Sex addicts also have poor discernment skills for choosing boyfriends.
sentences.chinese: 同时，性上瘾患者甄别合适男友的能力也差强人意。

sentences.english: Experts studying deception learn from the 'wizards' of lie detection.
sentences.chinese: 专家向谎言甄别”奇才“们学习，研究如何识别骗局。

sentences.english: The discovery raises the prospect of employers screening out applicants who take a glum view on life.
sentences.chinese: 这一发现有助于雇主甄别持消极人生观的应聘者。

sentences.english: Discriminate repeatedly, he gave Qiaosan and Cui Chunsheng the task.
sentences.chinese: 甄别再三，他把任务交给了乔三和崔春生。

sentences.english: So does the screening make sense in more resource-poor areas?
sentences.chinese: 那么，甄别，使更多的资源贫乏地区的意义吗？

definition: to study and come to a conclusion/to judge/to determine
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
